item.title: Toon Second Edition Brings Cartoon Chaos to Backerkit Next Week
item.content:encoded:
Steve Jackson Games has announced a revival of their Saturday morning cartoon TTRPG. The aptly named Toon Second Edition brings back an updated version of the 1984 original with some welcome modern touches, courtesy of an upcoming crowdfunding campaign.

The Toon Second Edition Announcement

According to its Backerkit page, Toon Second Edition is all about bringing the exaggerated, cartooonish, antics of classic Looney Tunes to a tabletop scenario. It's a game that runs on cartoon logic. No one dies, no matter how many times they are flattened by falling pianos and anvils; they're just temporarily taken out.

Naturally, the game is easy to learn and perfect for families looking for some old-school cartoon slapstick fun. The original release was notable for its tongue-in-cheek tone, parodying the rules and systems of more "serious" role-playing games on the market, like classic Dungeons & Dragons. The core design of the game even encouraged players to act with wild abandon, with advice like, "Act Before You Think."

Essentially, anything you can imagine happening during a Looney Tunes short is possible in Toon. The GM, or Animator, changing the environment to engineer cartoonish comeuppance. Characters breaking the fourth wall for the sake of a gag. All of it is here.

Toon Second Edition will include new quality-of-life improvements. This includes simplified character designs, enabling faster play, over a dozen customizable cartoon adventures, and improved Silly Tables. For fans of the original, this new rulebook will feature full-color artwork by the original artist, Kyle Miller.

Toon Second Edition is designed by Greg Costikyan (Pax Britannica), developed by Warren Spector (Bullwinkle and Rocky Roleplaying Game, The Thing in the Darkness), and revised by Steve Jackson (Munchkin, Fighting Fantasy).

The Backerkit campaign for Toon Second Edition will go live on December 17, 2025. The campaign will provide PDFs, softcover, and hardcover book options.
